data.title: Fix numeric variable checking
data.body:
Just a little fix: If the string given to create the variable starts with a number, for example "5 apples" or the classic color strings "150;255;150", GDJS set the variable as a number because parseFloat() take the first 5 and 150 respectively, this commit should fix it.
As always, feel free to fix the fix 😃

data.title: Default "Apply changes to whole animation"
data.body: Those buttons (apply points/masks changes to whole animation) active by default gives a lot of problems 😡 . I suggest to change them to false, at least the points one :)

data.title: Crashing when opening new project, Linux (4.11.6-3-ARCH)
data.body:
Currently getting similar, mostly identical crash to #343  but on Arch Linux (4.11.6-3-ARCH # 1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Jun 22 12:21:46 CEST 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux). Debugging with my limited skills, can always re-exec with the '--noCrashCheck' flag, but still crashing when opening a new project. Also can configure options, but Language is an issue, constant error message, but not critical. I cannot force with "--lang=en_GB" flag, nor does changing it to "US" or my system LANG seem to matter. 

gdevelop --version = **new-ide-beta1-16-g9fbc4613a** (straight from the AUR, pulls from git)

data.title: Please set CFBundleShortVersionString to release version
data.body:
Currently within the macOS apps info.plist the CFBundleShortVersionString reads as:

```
<key>CFBundleShortVersionString</key>
<string>1.0</string>
```

But release is 4.0.94.

Please can the CFBundleShortVersionString be updated inline with release as per:

```
<key>CFBundleShortVersionString</key>
<string>4.0.94</string>
```

This will aid us whom are looking to deploy this app to Macs that we manage.

Alternatively, some other incrementing value can be added there. Following semantic versioning or just incremented per build.

data.title: Can't install on Kubuntu 64 bits
data.body:
As said in the GDevelop's download page (http://compilgames.net/main-es.html), I put the following code in a terminal in order to install:

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:florian-rival/gdevelop
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install gdevelop

But after entering the last line of code, it says:

E: Unable to locate package gdevelop

Any ideas on how to fix this? Thanks.

data.title: Implementing In Game Currency

data.title: [solved] javascript code repeat each frame
Experimental new IDE (scene editor only) based on React+Electron
data.body:
This is an experimental IDE for GDevelop that I've been working on lately.
It's still pretty raw but the scene editor is usable.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1280130/23775899/5feb6284-052b-11e7-91d2-5c22f785847b.png)


## Technologies

This new IDE (located in `newIDE` directory) is written in Javascript, based on React.js, using material-ui for the user interface and Electron for packaging and running it.
As it's full Javascript, GDevelop core is compiled from C++ to Javascript with Emscripten (see [GDevelop.js](https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop.js/tree/incoming)) so that the new IDE can manipulate GDevelop games.

The current IDE acts as a server and is launching the new IDE and serving it the game, and the new IDE can also send back any changes.

## Why?

The idea is that the C++/wxWidgets based IDE is getting old and something new, fresh and Javascript based can be easier to maintain, extend and improve.
Javascript as a language is getting really nice (ES6), the ecosystem is vibrant and easy to learn.

It's also future proof as based on well known and maintained libraries. Complete compatibility with Linux should be super easy to achieve.

This is also a big step toward a complete IDE usable on web browsers, which would allow anyone with an internet connection and a recent browser to make games!

## State

For now, only the scene editor is usable. Here are a few screenshots:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1280130/23775707/43421d2c-052a-11e7-8428-ec18ba192755.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1280130/23775746/7a0b0eea-052a-11e7-92c8-7302ca4e9a7f.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1280130/23775756/91cd60b4-052a-11e7-9fce-aea4f4dc7814.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1280130/23775954/92500aa4-052b-11e7-952d-a47283d54079.png)


To use the new scene editor, the user will have to activate it in the preferences (at least while it's not fully done).

## Try it

It's still hard for now to try it because I've not integrated the building of libGD.js (GDevelop compiled to Javascript) to the full build. You have to manually get [GDevelop.js](https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop.js/tree/incoming), put it in the GD folder, and build it, then launch the script to copy libGD.js into newIDE.
I'll work to integrate this in the CMake build later!

My next step are to continue implementing the scene editor to make it usable with every existing objects and have all the existing features. 
And to make it easy for anyone to get it to try it or contribute 😄 
cc @victorlevasseur

data.title: event / read from file
data.body:
Hi,
I would like to read a text from a file and store it as a scene-variable.
I got the event, set all up, but the variable still do not change.

This is my event: [File: "file.txt" Group: "GROUP1" Scene: "distro"]
The action do work properly.

Here is the file.txt I want to read from.
`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?>`
`<GROUP1 texte="LinuxMint" />`

Why do this not work?

data.title: [QUESTION] Multiple levels in platformer?
data.body: Not a bug, but a question. If I make a platformer the objects and events are connected to a scene. Is there a way to make multiple levels (that use the objects and events) without having to copy them all the time?

data.title: Migrate to TinyXML 2
data.body:
The lib is much better and have better performances. And it also fix the whitespace problem (try putting multiple whitespaces in actions/conditions parameters and they will be ignored when the project is reopened in the released version of GDevelop).

 - [x] Migrate to TinyXML2 for project (un)serialization
 - [x] Migrate to TinyXML2 for storage/file conditions/actions
 - [x] Migrate advanced XML
 - [x] Remove TinyXML1
 - [ ] Testing
 - [ ] Improve GDCpp storage code

data.title: SFML offscreen rendering
data.body:
In the IDE, do the SFML rendering offscreen (thanks to a ```sf::RenderTexture```) and display it by drawing a ```wxBitmap``` on a ```wxControl``` (it manages focus, not like a ```wxPanel```).

**TODO list:**
 - [x] **Basic implementation**
 - [x] Adapt GDCpp and IDE to use it
 - [x] Generate all SFML events from wxWidgets events
   - [x] ```sf::TextEntered```
   - [x] ```sf::KeyPressed```
   - [x] ```sf::KeyReleased```
   - [x] ```sf::MouseButtonPressed```
   - [x] ```sf::MouseButtonReleased```
   - [x] ```sf::MouseMoved```
   - [x] ```sf::MouseWheelScrolled``` (and ```sf::MouseWheelMoved``` which is deprecated by the way and still used in GDevelop)
   - [x] ```sf::MouseEntered/Left```
 - [ ] Testing on Mac OS X @4ian 
 - [ ] Reenable preview in separate window feature

Confirmed on multiple systems with AMD and Nvidia GPUs.

Details (and error output in YT-video) under:
http://compilgames.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=8770

data.title: Plante à l'ouverture d'un projet
data.body:
Bonjour,

J'ai compilé GD, et il se bloque lorsque l'on ouvre un nouveau projet ou un exemple. J'ai le message suivant :

Bool attribute "folderProject" not found, returning 0Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Child effects not found in SerializerElement::GetChild
Child effects not found in SerializerElement::GetChild
The program 'GDIDE' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadAccess (attempt to access private resource denied)'.
  (Details: serial 161 error_code 10 request_code 2 minor_code 0)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the --sync command line
   option to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)

data.title: Scrollable instructions window and other layout fixes
data.body: The controls for editing the parameters are now in a scrollable wxPanel (wxScrolled) so that an infinite amount of parameters can be used without having a huge window.

data.title: Refactor arguments code generation using GenerateArgumentsList
data.body: Small refactoring for better readability

data.title: Dragonbones file support
data.body:
What is dragonbones - A free alternative to spine2d. It allows for cutout/2d mesh deform animation that has huge gains on animation size . Also allows for things like swapping body parts or overwriting movement via code.

It also allows:
- reusing the same animation clip on multiple game characters with different graphics
- big gains on local and virtual memory, gains in framerate
- Time saver in producing the actual animated assets
- Both editor and runtime are free 
- Smooth interpolation between animation clips
- smooth inbetweens , regardless of the framerate

www.dragonbones.com
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YO7JzI-f7sc

Spine costs 300$ for using their runtime - even if you dont have the editor
Dragonbones has all the same features, but is free

Dragonbones has a pixi.js runtime:
https://github.com/DragonBones/DragonBonesJS/tree/master/Pixi

which potentially makes it easy to implement in GD

Please implement support for dragonbones animation data support in gamedevelop. It will be a game changer for developing web and android games

data.title: Displayed a warning if the selected instruction is not available in one of the game's platforms
data.body: To warn the user that the instruction will be ignored in at least one platform that the project uses (that is not the current one as the instruction would have been hidden).
